intro: Leptorhynchos elongatus var. peduncularis, commonly known as the long-stemmed leptorhynchos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
